planner_edit_plan: Tightly mask and subtly brighten only the lamp head to appear switched on with a small confined neutral-white halo, plus a very faint consistent white highlight on the adjacent pole surface; no change to any other lights or overall exposure/color.
critic_notes: The edited image shows a strong, diffuse brightening/white haze across the upper-right sky and overall scene (global exposure/flare drift), not a tightly confined neutral-white halo limited to the streetlight lamp head. The lamp head glow looks overpowered and the surrounding sky gradient/contrast has changed, violating the plan’s “no change to overall exposure/color” constraint. Repair: re-edit using a tight mask on only the lamp head, add a small local halo (low radius, low opacity) and a very faint highlight on the adjacent pole surface only; avoid any broad sky/scene brightening or lens flare.

planner_edit_plan: Slightly widen each existing white stripe by a small, uniform amount inward from its current edges, keeping the exact stripe count, positions, and gaps unchanged and not extending beyond the current crosswalk footprint.
critic_notes: The crosswalk stripes in the edited image appear noticeably widened, but the change is not confined to a small, uniform inward expansion. Several stripes look extended/shifted relative to their original footprint and perspective, and some edges appear more re-rendered than subtly thickened, implying gaps/positions may have drifted. To match the plan, uniformly thicken each stripe only inward from both long edges (preserving outer boundaries), keeping stripe endpoints, count, spacing, and overall crosswalk footprint identical to the original.
